page.title: 03Sawston/Babraham Churches
page.content: The church of{St. Mary the Virgin}in Sawston. There are many big stone arches and when you rub them chalk comes off on your hands. One part of the church is 200 yrs. younger than the main part which is Norman, dating back to AD 1150. In the chancel thereis a back to front door which once led into a chapel. Under the carpet there is a small brass which tells of John Huddleston, Knight of the bedchamber to King Philip of Spain.The greater part of the church of{St. Peter's in Babraham}is 485 yrs. old. Parts of the tower are Norman. There are examples of 12th Century, Gothic and perpendicular architecture. The Bush and Benet tomb and the Reredos, given in 1700 by Lady Benet,are features of interest. The vicarage was sold in 1982 to a private buyer.
